criteria: Identification of Situations Requiring Adult Help
Understanding of Intimidating and Dangerous Situations
Knowledge of How to Access Help
descriptions: The student does not identify any situations requiring adult help.
The student identifies only one situation requiring adult help, but the situation is vague or unrealistic.
The student identifies 2 situations where adult help is needed.
The student identifies several situations requiring adult help, but some lack detail or clarity.
The student clearly and accurately identifies several situations requiring adult help, demonstrating understanding of potential dangers.
The student comprehensively identifies a wide range of situations requiring adult help, demonstrating a nuanced understanding of potential dangers and vulnerabilities.
The student does not demonstrate any understanding of what constitutes intimidating or dangerous situations.
The student shows limited understanding of intimidating or dangerous situations, with examples being unclear or inappropriate.
The student identifies some elements of intimidating or dangerous situations.
The student demonstrates a general understanding of intimidating and dangerous situations, providing relevant examples.
The student accurately describes the characteristics of intimidating and dangerous situations, demonstrating good awareness.
The student provides a detailed and insightful analysis of intimidating and dangerous situations, including psychological and social factors.
The student does not know how to access help for themselves or others.
The student suggests only one unrealistic or ineffective way to access help.
The student proposes some ways to access help.
The student identifies several ways to access help, but some are not entirely appropriate or effective.
The student clearly outlines multiple appropriate and effective ways to access help for themselves and others in different situations.
The student demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of resources and strategies for accessing help, including preventative measures and long-term support options.
The student is unable to communicate information clearly and accurately.
The student communicates information with poor language usage and inaccuracies.
The student has some inaccuracies and could use more clarity.
The student demonstrates clear communication with only minor inaccuracies.
The student can clearly and accurately communicate all information requested.
The student communicates clearly and accurately using appropriate vocabulary and presentation.
